I LOVED this hotel!  This was our first time at Disneyland Paris, and we LOVED our stay here and the experience of DLP.  The hotel is exceptional!  I have stayed at many WDW hotels and this one is one of my favorites as far as the room and the theming and fun details of all aspects of the hotel.  The location to the parks and the shopping and restaurant area (it's like a mini-Disney Springs that you walk through to get to the entrance of both parks) was fantastic.  We had a first-floor room (Spiderman floor- each floor was a different superhero theme!) so we were able to just walk out our patio to go to the parks.  The AMAZING attention to theming detail of Marvel just blew me away! A showcase of 3 full-sized Iron Man suits and another of 3 Capt. America shields!!!! WOW!! They even pipe in a subtle and lovely aroma perfumed scent throughout the lobbies that greets you upon entering (which you can buy a bottle of in the gift shop of course!).  The rooms were exceptional big especially when compared to most hotel rooms in Europe. We were a party of 4 adults, and we did not feel cramped. We used the indoor pool- it was nice- but it closes at 10:00 which is early if you're gone all day. There is also a cool kid's activity room that looked like it would be fun for little ones. The bar is themed like you're at the top of the Avenger's NYC skyscraper! We had dinner in the main dining room.  It was good tasting buffet food, good variety and it was presented with great Disney/Marvel flair. Vegetables, potatoes, and a few main dishes were cut out in mickey ears which was fun, the drinks were all Marvel hero themed and the desert bar!!! oh my goodness- that was the highlight!!! So many different kind of Marvel themed beautiful deserts- it was hard to choose.  They VERY MUCH need to build a 2nd hotel just like this one in Florida so I can stay there again! This hotel is too great to just have it in just one location.

The theming is premium throughout with a nod to marvel, greys, silvers and blacks with a pop of colour from the artwork. A gallery to walk each floor and area of the hotel if you have time, you wont see the same piece twice.  Downtown restaurant was very family friendly with a selection of great food but still set to a high standard. The meatballs in particular were melt in the mouth perfection! Definitely recommend a meal there, speak directly to Concierge via email. The room was premium with a good feel of modern and marvel. Smart tv and speakers than link via your phone to stream digital tv and speakers in the bathroom is a cool modern perk. No two rooms are the same with the artwork on the wall. Coffee facilities in the room are a bonus as other disney hotels provide coffee machines on each floor with 1 drink per night loaded onto your magicpass so to offer 4 espressos tea and milk in the room as standard was a good gesture from disney. Ice machines are available in 3 locations on each floor as well.  It is the closest of all hotels apart from disneyland hotel,literally a 30 second walk from disney village to reception so this is definitely a plus point.  There are cast members everywhere and nothing is any trouble. The customer service standard is very high.  Merchandise shop is small so dont get too excited, but it does house some artwork, toys and a fridge of cold drinks. A quick walk to disney village or across the water to newport bay will provide you with snacks and more merch.
